snippet: Some states are scaling back or even ending the popular tax policy that gives families a small break as their children head back to school....
abstract: Ann Carrns Your Money Adviser column observes that seventeen states are holding annual 'back to school' sales tax holidays in coming weeks, but some are cutting back on potential savings offered; Q&A on state sales tax holidays given.
lead_paragraph: Some states are scaling back or even ending the popular tax policy that gives families a small break as their children head back to school.

headline.print_headline: Back-to-School Sales Tax Holidays May Be Skimpier This Year
headline.main: Back-to-School Sales Tax Holidays May Be Skimpier This Year

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Institute on Taxation and Economic Policy
